resources.string: Only catch notifications that contain at least one of the following keywords or -phrases (one word/phrase per line):
Show popups for notifications that this app spawns.
Allow expansion of notifications that provide a bigger view.
Expand notifications with a bigger view as soon as their popup is displayed.
Light up the display when this app spawns a notification.
Press Back again to exit without saving. If that\'s not your intention, consider having a look at the options menu.
If you don\'t want to allow any action, you should rather exit without adding this app to the list.
If you don\'t want to allow any action for this app\'s notifications, you should rather remove it from the list.
This app is already in the list.
I don\'t know if the AccessibilityService is running, just let me check…
The AccessibilityService is running and Notify Me! can do its job.
It seems that the AccessibilityService is not running. Please check that Notify Me! is enabled in Accessibility settings.

\nIf you feel like you\'ve been here before, you might experience a bug in Android that prevents an AccessibilityService from starting properly. Try disabling and re-enabling Notify Me! in Accessibility settings.
If the popup\'s background color makes the notification\'s text unreadable, try inverting the background color. This should only affect Android versions < 3.
Show a slider instead of buttons to interact with the popup.
Set the background color for the slider

Now that you are here, you should at least know what this app does. To serve its purpose, you need to provide a list of apps that are allowed to use Notify Me!\'s services. Do this by adding (\"Add an app\") or removing (long tap on an item or via the menu in its settings) apps to/from the list. You reach a list item\'s settings by just tapping it. If Notify Me! doesn\'t do as it\'s supposed to, have a look at the main screen\'s menu and try checking whether the AccessibilityService is running.

An app to enhance Android™'s abilities to show notifications.

This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY. This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under the conditions of the GPLv3 or (at your option) later versions; tap the "GPL?" button for details.
Android is a trademark of Google Inc.
Enable this service to use Notify Me!. Otherwise it would not be able to register any notifications, which would render the app useless.
